finding: In a study of mers-cov infection in a group of expatriate women housed in a dormitory in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, the overall infection attack rate was 2.7% (Appendix Reference: 85).

In a multiple study of mers-cov infection in healthcare-associated outbreaks in Saudi Arabia in 2015, a total of 53 healthcare-associated cases were reported among hospitalized patients, of whom only 5 had documented presence in the same room as a mers case-patient (Appendix Reference: 79).

In a study of mers-cov infection in 2015 among 280 household contacts of 26 index case-patients in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, 19 (24%) tested positive for mers-cov by rrt-pcr or serology (Appendix Reference: 84).

In a study of mers-cov infection in healthcare facilities in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, in 2014, a total of 53 healthcare-associated cases were reported among hospitalized patients, of whom only 5 had antibodies to mers-cov (Appendix Reference: 70).

In a study of mers-cov infection in 34 household contacts in Jordan in 2015, 31 were asymptomatic or mildly symptomatic, suggesting a lower risk for transmission among this group (Appendix Reference: 80).
